authors: Monique Friedlander For Daily Mail Australia
description: She appears on the front of the Women's Health magazine's latest issue.
title: Jesinta Campbell looks exhausted while posing next to her trainer in Instagram snap
title_page: Jesinta Campbell looks exhausted while posing next to her trainer in Instagram snap | Daily Mail Online
text:
She appears on the front of the Women's Health magazine's latest issue the envy of women and desire of men.
And Jesinta Campbell demonstrated exactly why she nabbed the coveted glossy cover as she revealed the details of her gruelling morning workouts at Bondi Beach on Monday.
Taking to Instagram with a photo of herself looking flushed and puffed on the beach, the 24-year-old wrote: '10 laps Bondi Beach with 20 lunges to start each lap. Total = 10km soft sand run & 200 lunges'.
Scroll down for video
Fit and flushed! Jesinta Campbell, 24, shared details of her extreme workout as she took to Instagram with a photo of herself posing with trainer Dan Adair at Bondi Beach on Monday
'We dead @danjadair !!', she continued, making sure to tag her trainer Dan Adair, who stood next to her in the snap.
It wasn't long before Jesinta's legions of loyal Instagram fans showered the David Jones ambassador with compliments.
'Here I am still in bed with toast and coffee', lamented one fan in a comment.
Nothing to hide: The former beauty queen makes no secret of the fact that she works hard to maintain her killer bikini body
'Inspiration!' gushed another.
Nine Network host Peter Stefanovic also piped up with a congratulatory quip, writing: 'Jesus. I did two laps this morning and I was stuffed. Good on ya @jesinta_campbell'
The former beauty queen makes no secret of the fact she works hard to maintain her killer bikini body, telling Women's Health that: 'I'm doing weights training with [personal trainer Dan [Adair]. I get a lot of results, everything is more toned, tighter and lifted.'
Secret behind those abs: Jesinta revealed to Women's Health that she doesn't do ab work on a daily basis but instead maintains a strong core thanks to other exercises
Jesinta, who never lets more than two days pass between gym visits, added that she doesn't do ab work on a daily basis but instead maintains a strong core thanks to the other exercises she does, including Pilates and boxing.
She also makes sure to update her fans with in-depth breakdowns of her daily workout routines via her blog.
In a post updated before Christmas last year, Jesinta encouraged her readers to continue workout out over the festive season, writing: 'Balance is key so when I know I've got lots of events coming up where it's harder to eat clean, I put more effort in at the gym!'
'I'm a great believer in enjoying a glass of champagne and some decadent food every now and again, just don't make it a daily occurance [sic], advised the brunette beauty.
